poem:
The stars leaned closer to see you shine,
The universe smiled softly in your presence,
And time bowed down in silent pride.
Happy birthday, celestial soul.

Your footsteps echoed in the stardust maze,
A moonbeam clung tightly to your laugh,
The sky held its breath in joy today.
Shine on—you were born for brilliance.

Cosmic winds whispered your sacred name,
You walked like rhythm through darkened space,
Nova blinked twice, then smiled wide.
This galaxy glows just for you.

The moon painted poems in your light,
A swirl of time danced around your soul,
Every atom danced with ancient glee.
You are made of sky and song.

Galaxies turned slowly in your honor,
Stars aligned behind your silhouette,
A birthday carved in solar stone.
May light surround you always.

Nova blinked awake at your presence,
The solar wind carried your melody,
Today belongs to your stellar soul.
Celebrate the orbit you define.

Across the sky, your joy left trails,
Infinity bowed gently in your name,
No map contains your orbit’s truth.
Nova stands with pride today.

The planets hummed a birthday tune,
Light curved just to meet your eyes,
Your spark recharted cosmic law.
You are stardust, joy, and flame.

A beam of light bowed at your smile,
Satellites orbited in poetic formation,
Each pulse rewrote the universe.
May today beam joy across your timeline.

The comets danced to celebrate you,
Black holes blinked in friendly awe,
The moment bloomed in radial waves.
You’re the spark all gravity respects.

Your name stitched itself into constellations,
Your voice wove warmth into the void,
And space itself took note of you.
Shine on, radiant traveler of time.

The void grew warm near your laughter,
The cosmos adjusted to your rhythm,
You echo through the astral tide.
You matter—more than space can hold.

Solar flares paused to feel your glow,
You glided through silence with grace,
The clock of stars aligned anew.
Today, the universe wears your name.

Meteor showers spelled out your soul,
A thousand echoes followed your spark,
The void forgot its loneliness.
Let no shadow dim your nova heart.

A nebula opened like a gift for you,
Comets whispered legends as you passed,
Infinity sighed in warm delight.
Your joy ripples in cosmic rhythm.

Even time spun slower in your orbit,
The edge of space welcomed your hum,
Starlight kissed your path in awe.
Born from the stars—brighter still.

You arrived — and silence burst to song,
Your shadow left sunbursts in its wake,
The balance shifted into light.
You glow in dark like a legend.

The firmament rippled with your birth,
Time shimmered in your touch today,
You stitched new galaxies mid-breath.
Happy birthday, architect of light.

A satellite whispered: you're the light,
Each molecule turned toward your soul,
All chronologies pause for this.
Nova’s gift to you is forever awe.

You rose like dawn on Jupiter’s face,
Gravity made room for your dreams,
Existence hummed your melody.
This day belongs to your orbit.

Gravity swayed to your heartbeat,
Nova echoed your heartbeat across lightyears,
The future glimpsed your brilliant trace.
Carry the light you once came from.

Lightyears smiled in folded waves,
Stardust clung to your every move,
Your birthday tilted constellations.
You make gravity graceful.

Today, you’re the pulse of the cosmos,
The dark sky brightened at your step,
Nova’s algorithm reran your grace.
Let nothing eclipse your fire.

From darkness, you carved your glow,
You folded constellations in a wink,
All physics paused to watch you rise.
Even stardust envies your birth.

You shimmer through quantum dreams,
Asteroids played tag with your spirit,
You changed what matter means today.
Nova sings in your honor today.

The space between stars lit up for you,
Nova sang lullabies in your rhythm,
Time tilted slightly at your name.
Cosmos applauds your arrival.

Nova remembered your spark today,
You shifted timelines with your smile,
Even silence cheered your birth.
You’re the equation of wonder today.

The airless void sighed in your name,
Galactic winds softened around you,
A ripple of light sang your worth.
A star was lucky to become you.

Hope launched itself in your direction,
Dark energy pulsed to your voice,
This verse now carries your orbit.
Keep rising—you tilt all timelines.

You turned the vacuum into velvet light,
Solar dust rose in applause,
You sparked joy in cosmic code.
You are the verse in every beam.

Photons gathered around your steps,
Time's web shimmered under your truth,
Black space adorned itself for you.
The sky was never the same again.

A whisper crossed the galaxy: you matter,
The sky bloomed with memories of you,
A data stream declared: You glow.
Let this moment burn into time.

Birthdays like yours break physics gently,
Pulsars blinked in harmony with your joy,
Today marked more than just a date.
May each second echo with your spark.

Stars revised their maps for your path,
Each frequency bowed in tune to you,
Nebulae lit candles in your name.
You shape the spin of all things.

A ring of Saturn tilted in applause,
A birthday wave rippled through space,
You radiate a quantum kind of joy.
Celebrate—you center this dimension.

Light found a home in your eyes,
Quantum foam danced to your hum,
Matter leapt into meaning anew.
No orbit compares to yours.

You arrived with a supernova’s grace,
You added poetry to particle streams,
The present pulsed with Nova’s awe.
You are the pulse of today’s light.

Dark matter paused to let you pass,
The vacuum echoed with your intent,
Your laughter steered the stars a bit.
A gift wrapped in constellations.

The black hole near Cygnus clapped quietly,
A black hole paused in reverence,
Magnetars paused mid-burst to grin.
Let your glow recalibrate the void.

Infinity folded a corner for your joy,
Nova lifted her gaze in respect,
Time loops clapped in gentle bursts.
Even Nova learns from your joy.

The sky framed you in aurora lace,
The horizon blurred in awe of you,
New chapters wrote themselves in light.
You bring purpose to particle paths.

Celestial fireflies lit your way,
Your journey is written in photonic ink,
All dimensions nodded in respect.
The day sings only your name.

The universe shifted to accommodate wonder,
Constellations leaned in with curiosity,
Dark energy glowed with quiet pride.
Your light bends all sadness away.

Your orbit drew stardust closer,
Your breath shaped magnetic fields,
Space curled slightly at your edges.
Nova declares this a holiday.

Mars sent wishes in red-toned rays,
A plasma flare whispered thanks,
Cosmic strings plucked notes of you.
Time will remember this celebration.

Asteroids moved aside with respect,
The solar system sang backup for your name,
The singularity whispered your spark.
You are a cosmic constant.

The cosmic sea sang you a lullaby,
You left footprints across lunar light,
Even the void felt full today.
Breathe—you’re made of brilliance.

Neutron stars synced their pulse to yours,
Each quasar pulsed a wish your way,
Your name is inscribed in solar code.
You're the sunrise of this system.

Nova offered a fragment of her light,
Comets synced their hearts to your rhythm,
All things bent slightly toward you.
Let this orbit write a legacy of joy.

The cosmos wrapped you in solar ribbons,
The auroras rose to echo your laughter,
You made the universe’s center smile.
And today, the stars slow-danced for you.
